name: 蒲利亞
objective: The objective of this course is to help graduate students to understand the fundamentals of decision analysis. Besides, they will be taught how to research in the management context. Including lectures, group projects, and presentations, this course elaborates on the major soft and hard Decision Analysis techniques, i.e., Multiple-criteria Decision-making (MCDM) and Optimization, which are of high significance in modern business management. By the end of the course, students should be able to apply a variety of decision analysis tools to analyze and solve real-world decision-making problems.
scorePolicy:
Presentation and participation in the learning activities (20%)
Final evaluation (30%)
Term project (50%)
materials: Gwo-Hshiung Tzeng, and Jih-Jeng Huang. Multiple attribute decision making: method and applications. CRC, 2011; and the related research articles.
